pullRequest.body:
Next parts from PR #15524: relating `height` to 0, ‚ä§, ‚ä•, coe.

From the Carleson project

### PR summary [3fcf3a0ed9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19028/commits/3fcf3a0ed9613f76172f08f12f6de4b486a3688f)

#### Import changes for modified files

<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coe_lt_height_iff`
`+ height_bot`
`+ height_eq_coe_add_one_iff`
`+ height_eq_coe_iff`
`+ height_eq_top_iff`
`+ height_eq_zero`
`+ ‚ü®_,`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
</details>
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

> Can you check what the ENat API calls Nat.cast? Is it coe or natCast?

Good point. I see many more `coe` than `cast`, though:
https://loogle.lean-lang.org/?q=ENat%2C+%22coe%22
https://loogle.lean-lang.org/?q=ENat%2C+%22cast%22

Can you check what the `ENat` API calls `Nat.cast`? Is it `coe` or `natCast`?

maintainer delegate
It's worrying that these are not one-liners from the complete lattice API. Are we missing API for locally finite complete lattices? (except `ENat` is not actually locally finite everywhere, hmm...)

Can you check what the `ENat` API calls `Nat.cast`? Is it `coe` or `natCast`?

maintainer delegate

```suggestion
lemma height_eq_zero_iff {x : Œ±} : height x = 0 ‚Üî IsMin x := by
```
and I would think that the `_iff` is inferrable
```suggestion
lemma height_eq_zero {x : Œ±} : height x = 0 ‚Üî IsMin x := by
```

There are lemmas like
```
lemma height_eq_zero_iff_isMin (a : Œ±) :
    IsMin a ‚Üî height a = 0 := by
```
coming up next (https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15524/files#diff-f01f6dfbb94ae0c3a2d89d315b11b5fa88e9f864823c53d72130a3fe82adefb9R462). I guess then I can just delete this?
Oh yes probably
Included it here, as I need it below.
protected alias ‚ü®_ IsMin.height_eq_zero‚ü© := height_eq_zero_iff

`Iff` is a structure so you get to do
```suggestion
    n < height x ‚Üî ‚àÉ y, y < x ‚àß height y = n where
  mp h := by
    obtain ‚ü®m, hx : height x = m‚ü© := Option.ne_none_iff_exists'.mp (LT.lt.ne_top hfin)
    rw [hx] at h; norm_cast at h
    obtain ‚ü®p, hp, hlen‚ü© := exists_series_of_height_eq_coe x hx
    use p ‚ü®n, by omega‚ü©
    constructor
    ¬∑ rw [‚Üê hp]
      apply LTSeries.strictMono
      simp [Fin.last]; omega
    ¬∑ exact height_eq_index_of_length_eq_height_last (by simp [hlen, hp, hx]) ‚ü®n, by omega‚ü©
  mpr := by
    intro ‚ü®y, hyx, hy‚ü©
    exact hy ‚ñ∏ height_strictMono hyx (lt_of_le_of_lt (height_mono hyx.le) hfin)
```

```suggestion
lemma coe_lt_height_iff (x : Œ±) (n : ‚Ñï) (hfin : height x < ‚ä§) :
```

```suggestion
    height x = ‚ä§ ‚Üî ‚àÄ n, ‚àÉ p : LTSeries Œ±, p.last = x ‚àß p.length = n where
  mp h n := by
    apply exists_series_of_le_height x (n := n)
```
if you like

```suggestion
lemma coe_lt_height_iff {x : Œ±} {n : ‚Ñï} (hfin : height x < ‚ä§) :
```
since it's an iff. Same everywhere else

```suggestion
    obtain ‚ü®m, hx : height x = m‚ü© := Option.ne_none_iff_exists'.mp hfin.ne_top
```

Can you avoid starting newlines in the middle of an inlined statement?
```suggestion
lemma height_eq_coe_add_one_iff (x : Œ±) (n : ‚Ñï) :
    height x = n + 1 ‚Üî height x < ‚ä§ ‚àß (‚àÉ y < x, height y = n) ‚àß (‚àÄ y < x, height y ‚â§ n) := by
```
same below
The one below needs a linebreak somewhere, hopefully better now.

```suggestion
      height x < ‚ä§ ‚àß (n = 0 ‚à® ‚àÉ y < x, height y = n - 1) ‚àß (‚àÄ y < x, height y < n) := by
```
Does it still need a linebreak with that?

Yes, still. And the variant with `coheight` (to be added later) even more.

But it‚Äôs prettier that way, so using that.

Are linebreaks worth worrying about that much?
No. Was just making sure you did actually need it

```suggestion
    height x ‚â§ n ‚Üî ‚àÄ y < x, height y < n := by
```

```suggestion
The height of an element is infinite iff there exist series of arbitrary length ending in that
```
